00006 ORHardwareDictionary::ORHardwareDictionary(std::string name) : ORDictionary(name)

00009      dictionaries that might contain */
00010   fVectorOfBaseDicts.push_back("GPIB");

00014 bool ORHardwareDictionary::LoadHardwareDictFromDict(const ORDictionary* dict)
00015 {
00016   if (!dict) {
00017     ORLog(kError) << "Dictionary doesn't exist!" << std::endl;
00018     return false;
00019   }
00020   /* first let us find Crates and crate numbers*/ 
00021   if (!LoadCratesAndCards(dict)) return false;
00022 
00023   return true;
00024 }
00025 
00026 bool ORHardwareDictionary::LoadCratesAndCards(const ORDictionary* dict)
00027 {
00028   /* To document, fCrateMap holds a key with a pair that is:
00029      pair< Name of the crate, number of the crate >
00030 
00031      and a value which is:
00032      pair< number of offset (0 or 1), vector of cards filled. */
00033   if (!dict) {
00034     ORLog(kError) << "Dictionary is NULL!" << std::endl;
00035     return false;
00036   }
00037   /* First let us grab the crate list. */
00038   const ORDictValueA* crateArray = 
00039     dynamic_cast<const ORDictValueA*>(dict->LookUp("ObjectInfo:Crates")); 
00040   if (!crateArray) {
00041     ORLog(kError) << "Error finding ObjectInfo:Crates" << std::endl;
00042     return false;
00043   }
00044   /* Now load up fCrateMap*/
00045   for (size_t i=0;i<crateArray->GetNValues();i++) {
00046     const ORDictionary* oneCrate = dynamic_cast<const ORDictionary*>(crateArray->At(i));
00047     if (!oneCrate) {
00048       ORLog(kWarning) << "Crates array includes non-dictionary." << std::endl;
00049     } else {
00050       const ORDictValueI* crateNum = dynamic_cast<const ORDictValueI*>(
00051         oneCrate->LookUp("CrateNumber"));
00052       const ORDictValueS* crateName = dynamic_cast<const ORDictValueS*>(
00053         oneCrate->LookUp("ClassName"));
00054       const ORDictValueI* crateOffset = dynamic_cast<const ORDictValueI*>(
00055         oneCrate->LookUp("FirstSlot"));
00056       if (!crateNum || !crateName || !crateOffset) {
00057         ORLog(kError) << "Error finding Crate information." << std::endl;
00058         return false;
00059       } 
00060       /* Now grab the cards from the crate. */
00061       const ORDictValueA* crateCardArray = dynamic_cast<const ORDictValueA*>(
00062         oneCrate->LookUp("Cards")); 
00063       if (!crateCardArray) {
00064         ORLog(kError) << "Error finding array Cards" << std::endl; 
00065         return false;
00066       } 
00067       for (size_t i=0;i<crateCardArray->GetNValues();i++) {
00068         const ORDictionary* cardDict = dynamic_cast<const ORDictionary*>(crateCardArray->At(i));
00069         if (!cardDict) {
00070           ORLog(kWarning) << "Cards array includes non-dictionary." << std::endl;
00071         } else {
00072           /* grab numbers, grab names*/
00073           const ORDictValueS* className = dynamic_cast<const ORDictValueS*>(
00074             cardDict->LookUp("Class Name"));
00075           const ORDictValueI* slotNumber = dynamic_cast<const ORDictValueI*>(
00076             cardDict->LookUp("Card"));
00077           if (!className || !slotNumber) {
00078             ORLog(kError) << "Error getting card." << std::endl;
00079             return false;
00080           }
00081           /* Is there an offset? */
00082           //int slotCrateNum = slotNumber->GetI() + crateOffset->GetI(); 
00083           int slotCrateNum = slotNumber->GetI(); 
00084           ORDecoderDictionary* decoderCrateDict = 0;
00085           
00086           if ((fDictMap.find(className->GetS())) == fDictMap.end()) {
00087             decoderCrateDict = new ORDecoderDictionary(className->GetS());
00088             fDictMap[className->GetS()] = decoderCrateDict; 
00089           } else {
00090             decoderCrateDict = 
00091               dynamic_cast<ORDecoderDictionary*>(fDictMap[className->GetS()]);
00092           }
00093           /* OK, now load it up with the card/crate info. */
00094           std::ostringstream os1, os2;
00095           os1 << crateNum->GetI();
00096           decoderCrateDict->LookUp(os1.str()); 
00097           ORDictionary* crateDictForCard = 0;
00098 
00099           /* Insert crate if it doesn't exist. */
00100           if (!(crateDictForCard = dynamic_cast<ORDictionary*>(
00101               decoderCrateDict->LookUp(os1.str())))) { 
00102             crateDictForCard = new ORDictionary(os1.str());
00103             decoderCrateDict->LoadEntry(os1.str(), crateDictForCard); 
00104           }
00105           /* Finally making new dictionary from a copy and inserting. */
00106           ORDictionary* newCardDict = new ORDictionary(*cardDict);
00107           os2 << slotCrateNum; 
00108           newCardDict->SetName(os2.str());
00109           crateDictForCard->LoadEntry(os2.str(), newCardDict);
00110         }
00111       }
00112     }
00113   }
00114 
00115 
00116   return true;
00117 }
00118 
00119 const ORDecoderDictionary* ORHardwareDictionary::GetDecoderDictionary(std::string dictName) const
00120 {
00121   if (dictName.size() == 0) return NULL;
00122   const ORDecoderDictionary* dict = dynamic_cast<const ORDecoderDictionary*>(LookUp(dictName));
00123   if(!dict) {
00124     ORLog(kWarning) << "Decoder Dictionary (" << dictName << ") requested but not found" << std::endl; 
00125   }
00126   return dict; 
00127 }
